intro: Lilaeopsis andina, commonly known as Andean grass, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green or pale blue in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its unique adaptations, Lilaeopsis andina is of interest to botanists studying high-altitude flora.
